value.title: Azure Certifications for developers | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn about the Azure Certifications for developers. value.title: Azure Friday | Azure App Service with Hybrid Connections to On-premises Resources
value.excerpt: Christina Compy joins Scott Hanselman to talk about the recently relaunched App Service Hybrid Connections. This feature enables your apps in the App Service to reach resources on other networks. Those other networks can be in Azure, on-premises or networks in other cloud providers.   Azure App Service
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/y_zAJZC_8Yk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion. Kelly Anderson stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about how simple it is to set up Azure Backup, how its built-in
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HJeCqbbT-5s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure IoT Hub
value.excerpt: Olivier Bloch joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure IoT and how it is more than just about connecting IoT devices and sending telemetry to the Cloud. They also talk about Azure IoT device topics such as twins, provisioning, and lifecycle management.  For more information, see:  Azure IoT Hub - http://aka.ms/azureiotgetstarted

value.title: Azure Friday | Visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra shows Donovan Brown how you can now visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2 and be more productive by getting pipelines up & running quickly without writing any code.  For more information, see:  ADF v2: Visual Tools enabled in public preview (blog) - https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/adf-v2-visual-tools-enabled-in-public-preview/

value.title: Continuous integration and deployment using Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can follow industry-leading best practices to do continuous integration and deployment for your Extract Transform/Load (ETL) and Extract Load/Transform (ELT) workflows to multiple environments such as Dev, Test, Prod, and more. value.title: Introducing the Azure Data Box family | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Mathew Dickson joins Donovan Brown to discuss the Data Box family of solutions to meet the challenge of moving data to the cloud. Azure Data Box offline devices help you transfer large amounts of data to Azure when the network isn't an option. Data Box online products act as network storage gateways

Delivered as an Azure service, Azure Stack HCI provides the latest and up to date security, performance, and feature updates. To illustrate the flexibility

value.title: Secure traffic between pods using network policies in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Did you know that by default, all pods in a Kubernetes cluster will accept traffic from any source? Now, with network policies available out-of-the-box in Azure Kubernetes Service you can isolate pods, control egress & ingress traffic, and secure your workloads. Saurya Das is here to show us how it works.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/131_TIa_ftI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

Azure Sentinel provides a threat detection and mitigation service that helps you to detect incident and threats when they happen and helps you to solve them as effectively as possible.    For more tips and

value.title: Why did Microsoft move from ADAL to MSAL? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the advantages of using the Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) instead of the Azure Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL).   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 6: Describe Azure cost management and service level agreements
value.excerpt: Learn about the factors that influence cost, tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend, and how Azure's service-level agreements (SLAs) can impact your application design decisions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Choose the right Azure services by examining SLAs and service lifecycle
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure's service-level agreements (SLAs) and how they can impact your application design decisions. Also see how to access preview services and learn how they impact your planning.

value.title: Cloud administration basics
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types of services, in preparation for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.

topItems.title: Provision and manage cloud services
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the different types of resources available on the cloud and the technology behind how they work.

topItems.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about digital identities and how they can be managed and synchronized within an organization.

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: In this learning path, discover Azure Stream Analytics streaming data, the concepts of event processing, and integration of Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data.

topItems.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results

value.title: Plan and implement data platform resources
value.excerpt: Deploy data platform resources in Azure for SQL Server and Open Source databases. Explore options for upgrade and migration.  Calculate resource requirements and create templates.

topItems.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
topItems.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

topItems.title: Deploy MariaDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Compare Open Source Azure Database offerings with Azure SQL Server offerings. Configure an Open Source database and configure high availability and security options.
